Resolved Question Show me another » Worst food at Disney World?
5 years ago Report Abuse by tweetyma... Member since: April 07, 2006 Total points: 12,338 (Level 6) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Voters Honestly, I have never been disappointed with ANY meal at Disney World.
I have tried many different ones (of couse I haven't made it to all of them yet, there are over 300 places to eat there!!) 5 years ago Report Abuse 50% 2 Votes 1 person rated this as good
Action Bar: 0 stars - mark this as Interesting! Email Comment ( 0 ) Save Add to My Yahoo! Add to Del.icio.us RSS
There are currently no comments for this question.
* You must be logged into Answers to add comments. Sign in or Register .
Other Answers (11) Show: All Answers Oldest to Newest Newest to Oldest Rated Highest to Lowest by lilly Member since: May 29, 2007 Total points: 673 (Level 2) Add Contact Block the first person is SOO wrong! mexico is good! it has nachos, buritos tacos and all! i guess she doesnt like taco bell then! well the worst food is in epcot and thats u.k. DI-SGUS-TING! EWWWW! and their hot dogs arent to great either. 5 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes 1 person rated this as good by Natterja... Member since: July 10, 2006 Total points: 6,277 (Level 5) Add Contact Block There are only two places that I have ever been to in Disney where I thought the food was under Disney standards. The USA pavillion in Epcot center was bad when we ate there, which is pretty ironic when you think about it. Also, Cosmic Ray's Starlight Cafe was not that great, depending on what you ordered. The chicken sandwich was o.k., but the burgers my kids ordered, not so good. Other than that we have eaten at many, many of the Disney restaurants, both table service as well as counter service and never found a meal we didn't like.
If you want some more info, I would suggest checking out the disboards. The disboards is a message board website that is all about going to Disney. You will find a dining review section, trip reports, resort reviews, and just about anything else you can think of. You can ask questions and get responses back from people who go to Disney often and know what they are talking about. I put the link below.
I hope this helps! Source(s): http://www.disboards.com
Disney Vacation Club member 5 years ago Report Abuse 25% 1 Vote 1 person rated this as good by Beach Gal Member since: June 13, 2006 Total points: 12,153 (Level 6) Add Contact Block Interesting question. I'm used to answering about the best! The worst food on Walt Disney Property can be found at EPCOT in the U.S.A. Pavilion, ironically. Their food is awful. Someone mentioned Casey's Corner at the Magic Kingdom as being bad and I disagree! Casey's has great hot dogs and Polish Sausages! Be sure to visit http://www.easybreezyplanning.com There you can sign up for a free Disney E-newsletter, read up on fun tips and advice, watch fun Disney movie previews, purchase discounted Disney park merchandise and receive assistance with planning your Disney vacation! Have a wonderful trip! Source(s): Former Disney Cast Member 5 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes 1 person rated this as good by The Doctor 46 Member since: September 25, 2006 Total points: 594 (Level 2) Add Contact Block Umm i don't know the worst food but i know the best food.
(This is only a list of the places we eat at)
Magic Kingdom® Casey's Corner Pecos Bill Cafe Columbia Harbor House
Epcot® There is a place in Germany i don't know the name but my dad loves it you cant miss it when your in Germany i think its on the right of the fountain.
Disney-MGM Studio's ABC Commissary and then snack on the vendors/McDonald's Fries.
Disney's Animal Kingdom® We usually don't eat just snack. 5 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes by <3 Member since: June 13, 2007 Total points: 4,764 (Level 4) Add Contact Block definitly not the maxican restraunt in epcot...that was so good!! i think the worst is the food in morrocco in epcot...but the best food is the churros!! 5 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes 1 person rated this as good by gingers_... Member since: December 21, 2006 Total points: 364 (Level 2) Add Contact Block Coral Reef hands down. We've been to many of the restaurants since Disney World opened in 1971, having visited over 50 times. We were the most disappointed in Coral Reef, it's a never again restaurant, in our opinion. 5 years ago Report Abuse 25% 1 Vote by mottthed... Member since: November 30, 2006 Total points: 12,504 (Level 6) Add Contact Block I'm guessing that you're asking which is the worst food in the parks. While it might be hard to give an exact answer, as sometimes to me, it's what I pay for what I get. For example, just about any of the fast food places offer the exact same hamburger&fries, etc., for about the same inflated price.
If you go to a character breakfast, the only place that I would not recommend is at the animal park...it's at the McDonald's and while it's all you can eat...it's pretty much all McDonald's food. I think the last time we ate there it was around $15 a head for the character breakfast...and there is no way in the world my stomach could stand $15 worth of McDonald's food.
I agree with one of the other writers, forget the Mexican food at Epcot...no WOW at all. I did enjoy the food at the British&German restaurants however. 5 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes by itchiann... Member since: January 14, 2007 Total points: 9,340 (Level 5) Add Contact Block In all our trips and all the meals we have ordered, we have always been satisfied are well pleased. I have not heard of any problems with food. In regards to the comment about the Animal Park, if they are referring to Animal Kindgom's character breakfast, there is an option for McDonalds food, but it is only an option. I think all the character breakfast serve basically the same food. We have eaten at most of them and again, always been more than satisfied. 5 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes 1 person rated this as good by DCM Member since: January 24, 2006 Total points: 4,288 (Level 4) Add Contact Block Im not sure what your question is. I assume you are asking what is the worst food at Walt disney World? It really depends on what kind of food you are talking about, what type of restaurant, and how picky of an eater you are.
In general, the highest quality foods are served at the table-service restaurants. And of course, the more expensive the more likely you will get a finer dining experience, the Signature Dining restaurants which are Disney's finest restaurants have the finest food selections.
In the parks, you will find that all the"Quick Service Restaurants"which resemble a fast-food restaurant or food court all have very similar foods which are not of the best quality, many of these"Quick Service"foods are frozen and pre-processed foods such as the hot dogs, turkey legs, burgers, fries, etc.. This is why sometimes people with a sensitive appetite do not fair very well with these foods and can end up with an upset stomach.
Of course you will most likely not be able afford to eat at a table-service restaurant for every meal, but try to balance your meals and do not rely on only"Quick Service"meals as your only food option or you may get an upset stomach. Many of the resorts have gift shops and marketplace-style eateries that serve sandwiches and other grocery-style foods that are much healthier. Many of the parks also have select restaurants that serve healthier food options for health-minded guests, these locations are usually labled with an apple symbol on the park map.
Have Fun! 5 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes by maccrew6 Member since: April 05, 2006 Total points: 18,385 (Level 6) Add Contact Block The restaurant in"Mexico"in Epcot.. HORRIBLE!!!!!! 5 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes by reds_424 Member since: March 02, 2007 Total points: 875 (Level 2) Add Contact Block I love all the food a disney so there is no worst food
the best food is the turkey legs 5 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes 1 person rated this as good
